intro: Phyllorkis stenobulbon, commonly known as the narrow-bulb phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its bulbous root system and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale blue flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated by gardeners in suitable climates.
